title: Fivestar4everMVP
author: Fivestar4everMVP
content: Aliexpress have been my favorite for a long time now, but this was while Credit/Debit card payments worked in my country, right now, the Central bank of Nigeria have ordered all the banks in the country to terminate and block all Nigerian issued Credit/Debit cards from processing international/Dollar transactions, this simply means Nigerians can no longer carry out dollar transactions with their Naira Credit/Debit cards.Few days ago, I found something I loved on Aliexpress and wanted it badly, I contacted the seller to see if he could take payment in bitcoin, but unfortunately, he said No, I also tried a couple of other sellers who also don't seem to accept bitcoin payments./Right now, I am looking for another trusted online shopping site where bitcoin is accepted as a means of payments, and the site should be like Aliexpress that sometimes, offer free shipping to Nigeria for some of its products, I would very much appreciate any suggestions, suggestions must be sites that have been tried and trusted , I would have searched google for suggestions but I trust this forum far more than I trust google, and this is why I brought this here.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I know this may be not exactly what you are asking for, but have you tried to find websites which could offer you pre-paid debit cards which can be charged or bought with Bitcoin or other altcoins?Also, the only web I have seen which is similar to what you need is Purse (I have never used it myself before, though) but I think it only works for amazon USA and not with any Chinese provider...

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Banggood used to be the "poor brother" of AliExpress. I stopped using it after I've found AliExpress but you may want to take a look there since it ships to a lot of places (maybe everywhere, I don't know) and accepts many payment methods.I don't see Bitcoin on the list, but - depending on the country of the user - the list can be pretty big and maybe you can use bitcoin together with one of those payment methods....(For clothes there's also Shein, but it seems to have far too few payment methods; plus my wife has shopped from there only once, which is not enough for a proper review).

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: Shopify will let you accept BTC for the products you sell. It may not be as glossy the way you can customize it but it will do the job you want. There used to be some free script that I use to sell just a few items, its sort of a static page for a shop but I forgot its name. Unless you want sellers to register in your store, then that will only make it complicated.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: An alternative is to look into gift cards, see: Gift cards providersYou could also ask some people to buy the cards for you in case you couldn't find one from the providers above.Lastly, I suggest posting your situation as well in your local board since your people may know things members outside don't, see: Nigeria (Naija)

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: If you verified the Binance account then their Crypto Card might work but it looks like they do not support Nigeria because I can't find it in their supported countries?How about Paywithmoon they said they support AliExpress.QuoteMoon currently supports shopping on a limited number of sites, but soon you’ll be able to shop on any of your favorite e-commerce websites, like eBay, Ali Express and Target.Or your last hope is to buy gift card as suggested above.

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: @Fivestar4everMVPI posted a topic few months ago to ask almost the same thing but with no result.Later I found https://www.alibitress.com/it has all the products that AliExpress have in stock. If you place an order on AliBitress, the order will be paid by AliBitress on Aliexpress.It's a kind of middleman between you and AliexpressI haven't used it yet but I plan to give it a try.There is a topic about it athttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5419867.msg61255819#msg61255819

comments.author: Pezroly
comments.body: I think Aliexpress would be the best, if it was your favorite in the past. You just need international debit card, which you can top up with Bitcoin. comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Really amazing suggestions here, more than I even thought myself,Like payment through gift card, crypto card and all didn't even cross my mind, I will give every suggestion here a try and see which works out, which ever works out, I will let every one here know about it, just incase someone else comes around with similar enquiry..I will leave the thread open, just incase someone comes around with something completely new.Always following.

comments.author: merekamo
comments.body: I think, it's definitely frustrating when payment options are limited due to country regulations. I thinks it's great that you're looking for alternative shopping sites that accept bitcoin as payment. One site that I would recommend checking out is Overstock.com. They have a wide variety of products and accept bitcoin as payment. So, it might be worth checking out if they offer free shipping to Nigeria. Another option could be Purse.io, which allows you to use bitcoin to purchase products on Amazon. However, I'm not sure if they offer shipping to Nigeria.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: @Fivestar4everMVP, I don't know exactly what you are looking for, but if you want to pay in Bitcoin, maybe you could look at a site like this one : https://spending-bitcoin.com/Of course, there is always a risk when you buy from unknown sites and pay with Bitcoin, but it's always good to have an alternative when everything else fails.
